title: Understanding Motia: A Unified Backend System
explanation: Motia is a multi-language, event-driven runtime manager that simplifies backend development by unifying various concerns such as APIs, background jobs, queues, workflows, AI agents, streaming, observability, and state management around a single core primitive called the Step. Motia aims to reduce the complexity of fragmented backend development by providing a simple and consistent way to express all these patterns.
key_points: Motia is built on a core primitive: the Step
Every backend pattern can be expressed with the same Step primitive
Motia auto-discovers and connects Steps automatically
Motia simplifies backend development similar to how React simplified frontend development with components
Motia aims to unify various backend concerns into one system
example: The example provided demonstrates two Steps working together: an API Step that emits an event, and an Event Step that processes it.

title: Quick Start with Motia
explanation: The Quick Start guide provides a step-by-step process to create, set up, and run your first Motia project. It covers creating a new project, starting the development server, running your first workflow, and offers suggestions for further learning.
key_points: Create a new Motia project using npx motia@latest create
Navigate into the new project directory and start the Motia development server
The starter project comes with a pre-built basic tutorial flow
Complete the Tutorial to get an understanding of the basics of Motia and using the Workbench
Follow the Build Your First Motia App guide to build your first application from scratch
example: Create a new Motia project: npx motia@latest create. Navigate into the new project directory: cd <your-project-name>. Start the Motia development server: npx motia dev.
code_snippet:
```

npx motia@latest create
cd <your-project-name>
npx motia dev
```

title: Build Your First Motia App
explanation: In this tutorial, you'll learn to build a complete pet store backend system using Motia. The system will handle API endpoints, background jobs, workflows, AI agents, and real-time streaming. By the end, you'll have a production-ready backend capable of handling simple CRUD operations as well as intelligent, real-time systems.
key_points: Create HTTP endpoints that handle pet operations
Add async tasks that run without blocking your APIs
Coordinate complex processes with automatic transitions and validation
Add intelligent decision-making to your workflows
Push live updates to clients while your workflows run in the background
example: The example project is a pet store backend that handles pet management operations such as create, update, and list.
